results.title: The Incised image
results.brief_description: A film on the work of Charles Lloyd showing in detail the dry-point technique of etching and the possibilities of one-plate colour printing which he studied at Atelier 17 in Paris. Culminates in an animated sequence interpreting his statement - “each print is an adventure, a little journey of discovery”. The commentary is edited from his recorded discussions.

results.title: Henri Gaudier-Brzeska
results.brief_description: A documentary on the sculptures and drawings of the young Vorticist sculptor who was killed in World War I at the age of 23. The film emphasises Gaudier-Brzeska’s involvement with the Vorticist movement and Ezra Pound. Gaudier-Brzeska’s statements on sculpture are drawn from his extensive correspondence and contributions to “Blast”, the vorticist magazine. Much of the narration is drawn from the artists writings on his art.

results.title: Glove puppetry - Scenery and production
results.brief_description: Final film in the series devoted to “Creative Leisure’. The children see the culmination of their work then they assemble scenery and puppets for the staging of their play. The children paint the backdrop and throne; gather leaves and stalks for scenery; and make baskets, fishing line, and table as props before staging their puppet play “Snow White and Rose Red.”

results.title: Glove puppetry - Painting and dressing
results.brief_description: Children paint and dress their own puppets at the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre. The puppets being to come to life as colourful expressions are painted on, wigs added, and a strip of glue felted around the neck. Using a paper pattern, clothes are cut out, and then sewn strongly together.

results.title: Glove puppetry - making the heads
results.brief_description: Children make their own puppets to illustrate a story. After watching a play at the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre children learn how to mould puppet heads onto cardboard rolls with paper pulp. They use paper strips to add features, and finally leave them to dry on strands also made at the centre.

results.title: Galaxy
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: An experimental film using firework images, sometimes superimposed and sometimes in very soft focus. The mystery of outer space is evoked, its blackness broken by shooting stars and meteor trails, gaseous clouds and solar configurations. The sound track has reversed and slowed down triangle and cymbals added to an accelerated piano and xylophone.

results.title: Bouddi
results.brief_description: A camera calligraphy of the coastal bush at Bouddi, NSW. This film springs from a strong attachment to the Australian bush landscape, an echo of the spirit of kinship that imbued the life of the Aboriginal tribes. The film is a camera calligraphy moving through the bush, capturing textures, surfaces, shadows and light, details of foliage and expanses of rocks and trees, insects and birds - it sees the bush in much the same way as Aboriginal hunters may have seen it, moving rapidly through it. The complexity of the images is repeated in the Aboriginal music, visuals and sounds forming a rhythmic pattern.

results.title: Bottles into dolls
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Children's Library and Craft Movement
results.brief_description: Children learn to enjoy the art of making dolls from bottles, with plasticine. Imaginative use is made of a variety of materials at Brisbane’s Creative Leisure Centre. Costumes may be sewn, pinned or glued on to the figure and arms joined on with strips of plasticine. Finished figures are lined up and music-makers accompany the procession of completed dolls.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Children’s Library and Craft Movement

results.title: Along the beach
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: This film has no dialogue, however it’s evocative soundtrack and beautiful visuals are extremely touching. A young boy runs along the beach on Stradbroke Island off Queensland, absorbed by the shimmering, rhythmic waves, and the textures, shadows and patterns of all he sees on the sand - the footprints of tiny creatures, the undulating sand shapes sculptured by the ocean currents, the shells and seaweed and the shadowy fish trapped in a pool. Music: Nancy Tow. No other credits available.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Adventure playground: London
results.brief_description: Filmed in one of the Greater London Council’s adventure playgrounds where activities are built around tall forest trees. It shows the playground activities which appeal to children and in which they can engage with comparative safety and security in the presence of a play leader. All types of play equipment are obviously enjoyed by the children of all ages in the delightful park setting. A non-narrated films blending music and playground noises in its soundtrack.
